message:
The Muslim Brotherhood has called on people to remain on the streets and protect rallies, which have been set up for over a month to demand that Morsi is reinstated.

A pro-Morsi coalition has called on its supporters to sit-in and prevent a "blood bath". 

At least 15 people have been killed on Wednesday as security forces started an operation to clear the protesters.

Laila, a member of the Anti-Coup alliance which supports Morsi, told Al Jazeera that newborn babies had suffocated at protests as tear gas was dispersed on rallies.
